components.name: AlertListComponent
components.templateData:
<ng-template cdkConnectedOverlay [cdkConnectedOverlayOpen]="true" cdkConnectedOverlayPanelClass="alerts-overlay">
@for (alert of activeAlerts(); track alert.title;) {
  <!-- @for (alert of activeAlerts(); track $index;) { -->
  <app-alert-region
    [role]="alert.role"
    [title]="alert.title"
    [description]="alert.description"
    [politeness]="alert.politeness"
    [timer]="alert.timer"
    [duration]="alert.duration"
    (deactivated)="deactivateAlert(alert.title)"
  ></app-alert-region>
}
</ng-template>

components.name: DeferredLoadingViewComponent
components.templateData:
Deferred Loading

When using deferred loading, you should keep in mind, that screenreaders probably don't notice changes once the deferred block is loaded when already in focus.

on timer

@defer (on timer(5000)) { } @placeholder() { Placeholder... } @loading(minimum 3000) { Loading... } @error { Error... }

on viewport

Please scroll down below the bottom border to see deferred loading on viewport in action.

@defer (on viewport) { } @placeholder(minimum 3000) {
}

components.name: TrackViewComponent
components.templateData:
Track Demo

The example below shows the difference of tracking list options with $index and an actual unique attribute. By tracking a unique attribute, the object wont be completely new initialized. In fact, when the array changes, the focus of elements will be restored/tracked correctly.

Please enter a text in one of the input fields on the left side. After a few seconds, items will be added to the array of the list. Keep an eye on where you entered your text. While entering and concurrently adding new fields, your input moves into another field as only the $index is tracked. The list on the right tracks a unique attribute (item.id). This ensures, the focus does not accidentally move to another input event when the list updates concurrently.

Every 5 seconds a new entry is inserted.

Track: $index @for(item of items; track $index) {
}
Track: item.id @for(item of items; track item.id) {
}
Track: item @for(item of items; track item) {
}
